title: Db2 Zora Problem Prioritization
description: Help us understand which database problems impact you most. This survey takes about 5-10 minutes.

problems.title: Query performance keeps degrading over time
It's hard to identify the right indexes or MQTs for workload optimization
Query plans change unexpectedly and are hard to roll back
Blocking and locking issues are hard to detect and resolve
Queries spill to disk without early warning
WLM queueing causes slowdowns that are difficult to diagnose
It's slow to understand what changed before an incident
Anomalies in system metrics are discovered too late (CPU, I/O, memory, storage, responsiveness, locks, rows read)
Forecasting and capacity planning are unreliable
Deployment and upgrade processes are error-prone
Log management and analysis is painful (diag.log, archive logs, etc.)
Runstats and statistics often go stale without notice
Table health requires constant manual effort (skew, reorg, compression, tablespaces, indexes)
Scripts are scattered, fragile, and lack version control
Support tickets and diagnostic data collection are tedious
Which of the following best describes how your organization prefers to deploy database management and AI tools?
options: Fully on-prem (including air-gapped or isolated environments)
On-prem with limited outbound connectivity (e.g., for updates or telemetry)
Hybrid (some components on-prem, others cloud-connected)
Fully cloud-hosted
Not sure

problems.title: Which best describes your organization's current or planned infrastructure strategy for AI and data workloads?
options: AWS
Azure
Google Cloud
IBM Cloud
Private or sovereign cloud managed internally
Building or planning an internal AI data center (private LLM / GPU cluster)
No defined cloud strategy (mostly on-prem)

problems.title: Which best describes your typical way of working with Db2?
options: Entirely CLI / Automated - Almost everything I do is through command line or scripts.
Mostly CLI - I use GUI tools occasionally, but most work happens in CLI or automation.
Balanced - Roughly equal mix of GUI and CLI.
Mostly GUI - I use GUI tools for most work but switch to CLI for a few tasks.
Entirely GUI - I rely almost entirely on graphical tools.

options: Extremely useful — would likely use it often
Somewhat useful — for certain scenarios
Neutral — nice to have, not essential
Not useful — prefer GUI or automated workflows
